title: Married At First Sight's Ning Surasiang reveals she is launching her first cookbook
text:
She famously told her former TV husband Mark Scrivens at their wedding, 'I'm just here for the food and the drinks, not to meet you'.

And now Ning Surasiang's funny one-liner has become the title of her first-ever cookbook.

The former Married At First Sight star, 33, took to her Instagram on Saturday to reveal the exciting news and a first look at the cover to her legions of followers.

'Literally can't wait!' Former Married At First Sight star Ning Surasiang (pictured) has revealed she will launch a cook book called I'm Just Here For The Food

On the cover, she is seen posing in a wedding dress - complete with a sparkling tiara - holding a small model of a groom in one hand, and a cookie in the other.

Ning wrote in the caption: 'Start where you are, use what you have, do what you can... Amen!'

Before adding: 'Super excited I had to share! Literally can't wait for my book!'

Love and food: On the cover, she posed in a wedding dress - complete with a sparkling tiara - holding a small model of a groom in one hand, and a cookie in the other

'Only one giant cookie was harmed in the making of this book #minicookbook#comingsoon #imjusthereforthefood,' the mother-of-three joked.

Her MAFS co-stars also congratulated her on the upcoming book launch.

Cam Merchant wrote: 'Congratulations Ning! Amazing! The baked treats you would sneak into us in the house... Next level! Well done.'

Punchy: The book title I'm Just Here For The Food is a reference to a sarcastic one-liner she said to her TV husband Mark Scrivens at their wedding

Meanwhile, Cam's fiancée Jules Robinson said: 'Ohhhh, the curry puffs.'

Since leaving the show, Ning has made a name for herself on Instagram as a home cook, showing off dishes including chilli basil chicken, san choy bow and fried rice.

Ning married Mark Scrivens on season six of Married At First Sight, but in the final ceremony she revealed she couldn't see a future with him leaving the ex-army officer heartbroken.
